byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Aspen, Colo., and Peter Baker from Nairobi, Kenya.

abstract: United States officials say they will not object to parole of Jonathan J Pollard, man charged with spying for Israel who is eligible for release in November after serving 30 years in North Carolina jail; officials say Pollard's parole would have no effect on talks with Israel over Iranian nuclear deal.
lead_paragraph: The White House says relations with Israel will not influence the November release of Mr. Pollard, an American who was convicted of spying for Israel.

headline.main: U.S. Says Parole of Jonathan Pollard, Spy for Israel, Will Follow Law
headline.print_headline: U.S. Won’t Block November Parole for Israel Spy

snippet: The White House says relations with Israel will not influence the November release of Mr. Pollard, an American who was convicted of spying for Israel.
